metadata.synopsis: Shadowheart examines the mysterious puzzle box that she's been closely guarding. She has a mission to deliver this item to her cloister in Baldur's Gate, though doesn't truly know what it is. She tries to understand it, and possibly draws the attention of one of her companions - she shuts them down when they ask her about it, however. Note: a version this scene may have already occurred in the Druid Grove - this is a fallback that occurs at the party's campsite.
metadata.how_to_trigger: To trigger:Recruit Shadowheart (From debug book or otherwise)Recon: oe qnight NIGHT_ShadowHeart_Box_2de162ec-4272-4750-945f-9d306c5ba0daGo to camp

62.speaker: Shadowheart
62.text: Damn thing... it has to open, surely. It has to do something.
62.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avatar SH takes out box, turns it over in her hands, examining it.

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *You discreetly take the box from where you'd hidden it and turn it over in your hands.*
77.context: CinematicNodeContext: Avatar SH takes out box, turns it over in her hands, examining it.

63.text: *The runes engraved on the black metal mean nothing to you. You keep examining it.*

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *The runes engraved on the black metal mean nothing to you. You keep examining it.*

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *There are no openings, but for a brief moment, you think you feel something stir within.*

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *You tuck it away again. Your duty is to deliver it - not understand it.*
86.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH puts the box away

110.speaker: Shadowheart
110.text: Damn thing... it has to open, surely. It has to do something.
110.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Shadowheart turns the puzzle box over in her hands, looking for a way to open it while seated on the ground

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *Shadowheart's attention is consumed by a strange box that she turns over in her hands.*

61.speaker: Narrator
61.text: *Shadowheart's attention is consumed by a strange box that she turns over in her hands.*

79.speaker: Player
79.text: *The box is inscribed with glyphs similar to those used by the githyanki.*

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *The box is inscribed with glyphs similar to those used by the githyanki.*

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *The box is inscribed with glyphs similar to those used by the githyanki.*

93.speaker: Player
93.text: A githyanki artefact. How did you come by that?
93.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH puts the box away

30.speaker: Player
30.text: My kin's heirlooms should not be in your hands.
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH puts the box away

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I could crack open that little thing in one fist, if you want me to.
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH puts the box away

12.text: *In an instant, Shadowheart hides the box from view.*
12.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH puts the box away

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *In an instant, Shadowheart hides the box from view.*
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH puts the box away

40.text: It's nothing, trust me. Interesting choice of camp we have here, isn't it? Peaceful.
40.context: InternalNodeContext: Approval greater than 10 for the player.NodeContext: Airy, deflecting.

29.speaker: Shadowheart
29.text: It's nothing, trust me. Interesting choice of camp we have here, isn't it? Peaceful.
29.context: InternalNodeContext: Approval greater than 10 for the player.NodeContext: Airy, deflecting.

72.speaker: Player
72.context: NodeContext: A little philosophical (also keen to nudge conversation away from the gith artefact)

49.speaker: Shadowheart
49.text: You can really appreciate the quiet here. Not like in the city, where noise and life scarcely ever falls silent. It's not natural.
49.context: NodeContext: A little philosophical (also keen to nudge conversation away from the gith artefact)

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Nothing like a little calm and quiet after all we've been through.
57.context: NodeContext:  Politely getting rid of the player.

17.speaker: Player
17.context: NodeContext:  Politely getting rid of the player.

43.speaker: Shadowheart
43.text: To you, perhaps. For me, it's perfect. I think I'll enjoy it by myself for a while, if you don't mind.
43.context: NodeContext:  Politely getting rid of the player.

36.speaker: Shadowheart
36.text: You can really appreciate the darkness out here in the wilds. Not like in the city, where they keep lamps burning all hours. It's not natural.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks upward a little at the sky during the first sentence.NodeContext: A little philosophical (also keen to nudge conversation away from the gith artefact)

33.speaker: Player
33.text: I do like the dark. It's peaceful.
33.context: InternalNodeContext: Shadowheart approval increases by oneNodeContext:  Politely getting rid of the player.

7.speaker: Shadowheart
7.text: Quite right. On that note, I think I'd like some time alone, if you don't mind. To meditate. We'll talk soon.
7.context: InternalNodeContext: Shadowheart approval increases by oneNodeContext:  Politely getting rid of the player.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: No harm in brightening up the gloom. It's comforting, safe.

64.speaker: Shadowheart
64.text: To some, perhaps. But I'll enjoy the dark while I can. Alone, if you don't mind.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: I almost let you get away with changing the subject. Tell me about the artefact.
19.context: NodeContext: She gets on well with the player, but this isn't a secret she's willing to divulge.

106.speaker: Shadowheart
106.text: You deserve honesty more than most... but please, don't ask.
106.context: NodeContext: She gets on well with the player, but this isn't a secret she's willing to divulge.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: All right, I can respect that. But if you want to talk, I'm here.
27.context: InternalNodeContext: Includes subnodes for really githyanki

91.speaker: Shadowheart
91.text: I can't promise that'll be any time soon, but thank you, all the same.
91.context: NodeContext: Gratitude, with some slight guardedness.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: Not much of an answer. I'd hoped for more openness.
46.context: InternalNodeContext: Includes subnodes for really githyanki

10.speaker: Shadowheart
10.text: I'm sorry. I can't give you that. Not right now.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Why're you so keen to dodge questions about that thing?
26.context: InternalNodeContext: Includes subnodes for really githyanki

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Use the parasite - see what she's hiding.
78.context: InternalNodeContext: Intended as a joke - not a serious accusation

52.speaker: Shadowheart
52.text: *You feel Shadowheart's deep protectiveness of the artefact. Though she doesn't understand it, she believes that her fate is entwined with it somehow.*
52.context: InternalNodeContext: Intended as a joke - not a serious accusation

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *You feel Shadowheart's deep protectiveness of the artefact. Though she doesn't understand it, she believes that her fate is entwined with it somehow.*
70.context: InternalNodeContext: Intended as a joke - not a serious accusation

90.speaker: Player
90.text: Keep focused. Whatever that thing is, it's not important.
90.context: InternalNodeContext: Intended as a joke - not a serious accusation

39.speaker: Shadowheart
39.text: That's not for you to decide. There's a world beyond us. I'd like to be alone now, please.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: Admit it - there's a cure for ceremorphosis in that thing, isn't there?
35.context: InternalNodeContext: Intended as a joke - not a serious accusation

6.speaker: Shadowheart
6.text: Exactly. I'm just waiting for you to get really desperate before naming my price.
6.context: InternalNodeContext: SH approval of player increases by 5NodeContext: Amused, playing along with the player's joke accusartion.

54.speaker: Shadowheart
54.text: I'd like some time alone now. We'll talk soon.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Remember, our fates are entwined now. Relics and secrets don't matter with what we're facing.
85.context: InternalNodeContext: SH approval of player is more than 10NodeContext: Torn. May be willing to open up eventually, but not yet.

69.speaker: Shadowheart
69.text: I wish that was true. But I've seen plenty of blood spilled for just those kinds of things. The world will keep on scheming, no matter what happens to us.
69.context: InternalNodeContext: SH approval of player is more than 10NodeContext: Torn. May be willing to open up eventually, but not yet.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: For someone so secretive, you really seem like you want to open up.
94.context: InternalNodeContext: SH approval of player is more than 10NodeContext: Torn. May be willing to open up eventually, but not yet.

51.speaker: Shadowheart
51.text: I do. But I won't. Not yet.
51.context: InternalNodeContext: SH approval of player is more than 10NodeContext: Torn. May be willing to open up eventually, but not yet.

16.speaker: Shadowheart
16.text: I do. But I won't. I can't.
16.context: InternalNodeContext: SH approval of player is less than 10NodeContext: Torn.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: Don't be so cynical. It won't help us.
41.context: InternalNodeContext: SH approval of player increases by 5

53.speaker: Shadowheart
53.text: It won't. But I prefer it to just being frightened. I'd like to be alone now, please.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: If you don't want to talk anymore, I'll respect that.
21.context: InternalNodeContext: SH approval of player increases by 5

109.speaker: Shadowheart
109.text: Thank you. We can talk again soon.
109.context: InternalNodeContext: SH approval of player increases by 5

95.text: I felt that - are you really surprised I won't open up when you keep trying to fumble in my head? Leave me alone.
95.context: InternalNodeContext: SH approval of player drops by 10  (first time caught using mindmeld)NodeContext: Sudden sharp anger. Caught the player trying to read her thoughts (second offence)

101.speaker: Shadowheart
101.text: I felt that - are you really surprised I won't open up when you keep trying to fumble in my head? Leave me alone.
101.context: InternalNodeContext: SH approval of player drops by 10  (first time caught using mindmeld)NodeContext: Sudden sharp anger. Caught the player trying to read her thoughts (second offence)

44.speaker: Shadowheart
44.text: I felt that - are you really surprised I won't open up when you try to fumble in my head? Leave me alone.
44.context: InternalNodeContext: SH approval of player drops by 5 (first time caught using mindmeld)NodeContext: Sudden sharp anger. Caught the player trying to read her thoughts.

92.speaker: Shadowheart
92.text: It's nothing, trust me. Beautiful evening, isn't it?
92.context: InternalNodeContext: Approval greater than 10 for the player.NodeContext: Airy, deflecting.

84.speaker: Shadowheart
84.text: Never mind. Private matter, that's all.
84.context: InternalNodeContext: If SH approval of player is greater than 0 but less than 10NodeContext: Firm but reasonably polite shut-down

102.speaker: Shadowheart
102.text: Now, how're you faring this evening?
102.context: NodeContext: Airy.Very consciously changing the subject from what the player asked about.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Don't change the subject - tell me about the artefact.

11.speaker: Shadowheart
11.text: I've told you all I'm going to tell you. Now please don't pry any further, or you might force me to become less polite.

105.speaker: Player
105.context: NodeContext: Defusing. Returning to the previous topic

25.speaker: Shadowheart
25.text: Good. Now I believe I was asking you how you were this evening?
25.context: NodeContext: Defusing. Returning to the previous topic

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Better than I'd have expected, all things considered.

100.speaker: Shadowheart
100.text: The nomad's life has its charms. You get to meet such interesting people - and sometimes they don't even try to kill you.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Honestly, the parasite frightens me more than anything else we've encountered.

65.speaker: Player
65.text: I suppose you're right - I'm glad I met you, for one.

47.speaker: Shadowheart
47.text: My, quite charming when you want to be, aren't you? Maybe save some for the next time we have to talk our way past a sentry or the like.

76.speaker: Shadowheart
76.text: We should get some rest. I doubt tomorrow will be any easier than today.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Interesting? The company's the worst part, as I see it.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Honestly? Miserable. I'd rather spend the night just about anywhere else but here.

22.speaker: Shadowheart
22.text: Oh. You don't say that because of the company, I hope?

87.speaker: Player
87.text: The company's fine. It's the constant danger and thought of becoming a monster that bothers me.

98.speaker: Shadowheart
98.text: I know how you feel, trust me. But there's not much we can do until morning.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: No. Especially not when I have you around.

24.speaker: Shadowheart
24.text: Oh stop, you can hardly be that miserable if you have energy for flirting.

5.speaker: Shadowheart
5.text: You should get some rest. Things will seem better come morning. I hope.

59.speaker: Shadowheart
59.text: Hmm. In that case, let me spare you the worst. Good night.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Not good enough. I want answers.

4.speaker: Shadowheart
4.text: Then go read a book, or pray to your god of choice - just leave me alone.

55.speaker: Shadowheart
55.context: InternalNodeContext: Approval less than 0  for the player

28.speaker: Player
28.context: NodeContext: Said with a slight bit of coyness. She might like the player quite a bit. But she's playing her cards close.

81.speaker: Shadowheart
81.text: I'm being interrupted, that's what. We can talk later.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: No need to be so secretive. You can trust me.
13.context: NodeContext: Said with a slight bit of coyness. She might like the player quite a bit. But she's playing her cards close.

104.speaker: Shadowheart
104.text: Our mutual... respect only entitles you to so much. Now, if you don't mind.
104.context: NodeContext: Said with a slight bit of coyness. She might like the player quite a bit. But she's playing her cards close.

68.speaker: Shadowheart
68.text: A bold statement, if not an accurate one. Leave me be.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Speak plainly. What are you doing with a gith artefact?

31.speaker: Shadowheart
31.text: I said keep out of it. In fact, forget it entirely.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Let me try - I always enjoy opening up what I'm not supposed to.

108.text: *The box is inscribed with unfamiliar glyphs.*

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *The box is inscribed with unfamiliar glyphs.*

38.speaker: Player
38.text: What is that you have there?
